alert.note: Alert for Van Buren (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 04 at 7:14PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Van Buren, eastern Scotland and northwestern Clark Counties through 745 PM CDT... At 714 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cantril, or 10 miles south of Keosauqua, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Keosauqua around 725 PM CDT. Bonaparte and Bentonsport/Vernon around 730 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Stockport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
